requirement_tested: A frontend application that fetches all to-do data from backend APIs
user_persona: A busy professional who manages daily tasks through a digital to-do list.
user_goal: View all existing to-do items upon opening the app.

narrative_steps.title: Opening the Application
narrative_steps.description: Sarah opens her browser and navigates to the to-do list application URL hoping to see her tasks.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the homepage URL.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The page loads with a lavender background and indigo-themed header, preparing to display to-do items.

narrative_steps.title: Fetching To-Do Items
narrative_steps.description: Upon landing, Sarah waits for the app to load her list of tasks from the server.
narrative_steps.action: Page loads and automatically triggers a GET request to /api/todos.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All to-do items are fetched and displayed in a list view with titles, descriptions, due dates, and completion status using indigo-styled cards.

requirement_tested: A backend API that connects to a PostgreSQL database using specified environment variables
user_persona: A developer deploying the application locally for testing purposes.
user_goal: Verify that the backend successfully connects to the PostgreSQL database.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Backend Server
narrative_steps.description: Jamie runs the backend server locally and expects it to connect to the configured PostgreSQL instance.
narrative_steps.action: Start the backend service with correct environment variables set.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Server logs indicate successful connection to PostgreSQL at localhost:5432 with username myappuser and database myapp.

requirement_tested: Functionality to create new to-do items with title, description, and due date
user_persona: A student organizing study sessions throughout the week.
user_goal: Add a new task to prepare for an upcoming exam.

narrative_steps.title: Initiating Task Creation
narrative_steps.description: Alex clicks on the 'Add Task' button to begin entering details about studying for finals.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Add Task' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: An indigo-styled modal form appears with input fields for title, description, and due date.

narrative_steps.title: Filling Out Details
narrative_steps.description: Alex fills out the form with the title 'Study for Calculus Final', adds notes in the description, and selects tomorrowâ€™s date.
narrative_steps.action: Fill the title, description, and select a due date.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Form fields accept the input values without error.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting New Task
narrative_steps.description: After reviewing the details, Alex submits the form to add the task to their list.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Submit' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A POST request is made to /api/todos, and the newly added task appears at the top of the list.

requirement_tested: Functionality to edit existing to-do items including title, description, and due date
user_persona: A project manager adjusting timelines and task descriptions.
user_goal: Update an old task's deadline and clarify its description.

narrative_steps.title: Selecting Task to Edit
narrative_steps.description: Taylor notices an outdated task titled 'Weekly Report' and decides to update it with clearer instructions and a new due date.
narrative_steps.action: Click the pencil/edit icon next to the 'Weekly Report' task.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: An indigo-styled edit form opens pre-filled with current task data.

narrative_steps.title: Updating Information
narrative_steps.description: Taylor modifies the description to specify formatting requirements and changes the due date to next Monday.
narrative_steps.action: Modify the description and due date fields.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Fields update with new values without triggering validation errors prematurely.

narrative_steps.title: Saving Changes
narrative_steps.description: Satisfied with the edits, Taylor saves the updated task.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A PUT request is sent to /api/todos/{id}, and the task in the list reflects the updated description and due date immediately.

requirement_tested: Functionality to delete to-do items permanently
user_persona: A freelancer cleaning up completed client work from last month.
user_goal: Remove an obsolete task they no longer need tracked.

narrative_steps.title: Identifying Task to Delete
narrative_steps.description: Jordan scrolls through the list and finds a completed task called 'Client Feedback Review' which he wants to remove permanently.
narrative_steps.action: Locate and click the trash/delete icon associated with the task.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A DELETE request is sent to /api/todos/{id}.

narrative_steps.title: Confirming Deletion
narrative_steps.description: The task disappears instantly from the list view after deletion completes.
narrative_steps.action: Wait for response from DELETE endpoint.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Task is removed from the UI without requiring manual refresh.

requirement_tested: Ability to mark tasks as completed or uncompleted
user_persona: A parent tracking household chores assigned to children.
user_goal: Mark a chore as done once finished by their child.

narrative_steps.title: Finding the Task
narrative_steps.description: Morgan sees the task 'Clean Bedroom' still marked as incomplete and wants to check it off since it's been completed.
narrative_steps.action: Click the checkbox beside the task.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A PATCH request is sent to /api/todos/{id}/complete, and the checkbox visually toggles to checked state immediately.

requirement_tested: Filtering capability to show all, active, or completed tasks
user_persona: A remote worker focusing only on pending assignments today.
user_goal: See only the tasks that remain active.

narrative_steps.title: Applying Filter
narrative_steps.description: Casey wants to focus solely on unfinished tasks and selects the 'Active' filter option.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Active' filter tab/button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: GET request is sent to /api/todos?filter=active, and the list updates to show only non-completed tasks.

requirement_tested: Search functionality to find tasks by keywords in title or description
user_persona: A team lead looking for a specific meeting prep task buried among dozens.
user_goal: Quickly locate a task related to budget planning.

narrative_steps.title: Entering Search Term
narrative_steps.description: Riley remembers there was a task involving 'budget approval' but doesn't recall exactly where it is.
narrative_steps.action: Type 'budget approval' into the search bar.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Debounced GET request is triggered to /api/todos?search=budget+approval, and matching tasks appear in real time.

requirement_tested: Display all to-do items in a list view with key details visible
user_persona: A new user exploring the app for the first time.
user_goal: Understand what tasks exist and get a quick overview.

narrative_steps.title: Initial Overview
narrative_steps.description: Quinn opens the app and scans the main screen to understand how tasks are presented.
narrative_steps.action: Load the main page and observe the task listing.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Tasks are displayed in vertical indigo-styled cards or rows showing title, description snippet, due date, and completion status clearly.

requirement_tested: Responsive UI design with lavender background and indigo components across all pages
user_persona: A designer checking cross-device compatibility of the application.
user_goal: Ensure consistent styling regardless of device used.

narrative_steps.title: Testing Mobile Layout
narrative_steps.description: Dana views the app on a smartphone to ensure elements adapt properly.
narrative_steps.action: Resize browser window or open app on mobile device.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Lavender background remains intact and indigo components maintain proper sizing and alignment across different screen sizes.

requirement_tested: Real-time synchronization between frontend and backend for all CRUD operations
user_persona: Two users collaborating on shared tasks remotely.
user_goal: Ensure both users see live updates when one makes changes.

narrative_steps.title: Simultaneous Editing
narrative_steps.description: One user marks a task as complete while another deletes a different task.
narrative_steps.action: Perform concurrent create/update/delete actions from multiple clients.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both users observe synchronized updates in real time without needing to manually refresh the page.

requirement_tested: Error handling for failed API requests or database connections
user_persona: A user experiencing intermittent network issues.
user_goal: Receive helpful feedback when something goes wrong.

narrative_steps.title: Encountering Failure
narrative_steps.description: While trying to submit a new task, Pat experiences a momentary loss of connectivity.
narrative_steps.action: Attempt to create a task when offline or API is unreachable.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: An indigo-themed toast notification pops up informing the user that the operation failed and suggesting retry.

requirement_tested: Validation for required fields when creating or editing tasks
user_persona: A distracted multitasker prone to missing fields.
user_goal: Be prompted to fill in necessary information before saving.

narrative_steps.title: Leaving Required Field Blank
narrative_steps.description: Asher tries to save a new task but forgets to enter a title.
narrative_steps.action: Leave the title field empty and attempt to submit the form.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Submission is blocked, and the title field highlights red with an error message indicating it's required.

requirement_tested: Pagination or infinite scroll for browsing long lists of tasks
user_persona: A meticulous planner managing hundreds of weekly tasks.
user_goal: Effortlessly navigate through many tasks without performance lag.

narrative_steps.title: Scrolling Through Long List
narrative_steps.description: Blair has accumulated over 50 tasks and begins scrolling down the list.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll toward the bottom of the task list.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Additional tasks are loaded dynamically via GET /api/todos?page=x&limit=y, preventing overwhelming initial load times.

requirement_tested: Package.json configured with npm run install:all and npm run dev scripts
user_persona: A new contributor setting up the codebase for local development.
user_goal: Install dependencies and start both services efficiently.

narrative_steps.title: Installing Dependencies
narrative_steps.description: Charlie clones the repo and wants to quickly set up everything needed to develop.
narrative_steps.action: Run command 'npm run install:all' in terminal.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Frontend and backend dependencies are installed concurrently without errors.

narrative_steps.title: Running Development Servers
narrative_steps.description: Once setup is done, Charlie starts working on features by launching both environments.
narrative_steps.action: Run command 'npm run dev'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend servers start concurrently, ready for development.
